intro: Hedyotis globiceps, commonly known as the globular millepenny, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from autumn to winter. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Hedyotis globiceps is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
